oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Optically controlled periodical chain of quantum rings
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hasan, M.
Iorsh, I. V.
Kibis, O. V.
Shelykh, I. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We demonstrated theoretically that a circularly polarized electromagnetic field substantially modifies electronic properties of a periodical chain of quantum rings. Particularly, the field opens band gaps in the electron energy spectrum of the chain, generates edge electron currents and induces the Fano-like features in the electron transport through the finite chain. These effects create physical prerequisites for the development of optically controlled nanodevices based on a set of coupled quantum rings.
